about_the_game:
This album maps the journey of our characters in the game, from dangerous engagements with The Archon, to the immersive atmospheres of various stars, planets and other celestial events, to the meeting of powerful aliens and mystical entities along the way.

The music for Out There: Oceans of Time began in August 2019, with the teaser trailer. The soundtrack was mostly created through lots of jam sessions using analog and digital synthesizers to create an organic, immersive experience.

At times you may also hear the subtle sounds of rainsticks, singing bowls, spolum drum and stone. However, aside from the hardware & software synthesizers and other recorded instruments, I had the pleasure of including live performances of vocals by Viktorija Kukule and Lara Ausensi and cello by Sophie Snow.

Total playtime: 4 hours 31 minutes

Credits:

Music composed by Siddhartha Barnhoorn

Analog and digital synthesizers include: Ensoniq ESQ1, Korg MS10, Moog Mother 32, Oberheim Matrix-1000 and Eurorack Modular.
Effects include: Lexicon PCM70 & PCM80, Roland RE-501 Chorus Echo, EHX Small Stone and Flux FX Liquid Ambience.
Also included: rain sticks, stone, singing bowls, spolum drum, shakuhatchi flute, electric guitar and processed vocals

Vocals by Viktorija Kukule
(in tracks; 1, 6, 10, 11, 12, 13, 15, 62, 69, 70 and 71)

Vocals by Lara Ausensi
(in tracks; 8, 13, 78 and 79)

Cello by Sophie Snow
(in tracks; 62 and 71)

Artwork by Benjamin Carré
